keyword: calories in a cobb salad from chick fil a
title: Calories in a Chick-fil-A Cobb Salad
meta_description: Discover calories in a Cobb salad from Chick-fil-A, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, carbs, and tips for customizations.
h1: Calories in a Chick-fil-A Cobb Salad
assumptions: Standard grilled chicken Cobb salad with mixed greens, tomatoes, bacon, hard-boiled egg, cheese, and corn; no dressing included.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, customizations, portion size, and preparation; values based on Chick-fil-A's standard menu. Check app or site for latest.

quick_answer.text: A Chick-fil-A Cobb salad with grilled chicken has about 540 kcal and 40 g protein.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts panel for straightforward comparison to menu items.

tweaks.label: Add Avocado Lime Ranch dressing (1 packet)
Swap to crispy chicken instead of grilled
Remove cheese and bacon for lighter version

faqs.q: How many calories in a Chick-fil-A Cobb salad without dressing?
faqs.a: Approximately 540 kcal for the standard grilled chicken version.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in Chick-fil-A Cobb salad?
faqs.a: About 40 g of protein per full salad with grilled chicken.

faqs.q: Does Chick-fil-A Cobb salad have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 1440 mg due to bacon, cheese, and seasoning.

faqs.q: Calories in Chick-fil-A Cobb salad with fried chicken?
faqs.a: Roughly 640 kcal, an increase of about 100 kcal from grilled.

faqs.q: Can I make Chick-fil-A Cobb salad lower calorie?
faqs.a: Opt for no dressing, remove bacon/cheese, or choose lighter toppings to reduce by 150+ kcal.
